head.title: Beetles by Day, Weevils by Night

hedline.hl1: Beetles by Day, Weevils by Night

block.p: Japanese beetles, viburnum leaf beetles and Colorado potato beetles are feeding by day, and black vine weevils and twobanded Japanese weevils by night. Handpick them and crush or drop into soapy water. To control the next generation of weevils, drench soil with beneficial nematodes until early fall. Lots of rain and temperatures above 75 are perfect for the fungus phytophora, which afflicts snapdragons and other popular annuals. If they suddenly wilt, remove and destroy them.
